reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for three nights. We enjoyed the stylish and well equipped room, but our river view (for which a premium was charged) could be seen only through narrow slot-style windows. The location is OK, close to museums and the the ferries but it is separated from Liverpool downtown by an 8 lane road.
reviews.title: Property great, people need work

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: What we didn't enjoy was the service which either showed attitude and condescension (at the front desk) or incompetence (in the restaurant, which charges London prices).
reviews.title: Fantastic stay
Amazing Hotel
reviews.text: Be aware that this seems to be the most fashionable hotel in Liverpool at the moment and seems to do a big trade in weddings, celebrations and get-togethers. We enjoyed the life they brought but others may prefer something quieter.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Liverpool is a great destination, well worth a visit, and currently seems to be under-rated by travellers. When that starts to change and this hotel gets some competition it will need to improve its people to maintain relevance.
reviews.title: valentines

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed in this hotel as we were attending a concert at the Echo Arena. Very good location. Staff organised a taxi for us which cost less than £5.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel, Location and Staff
Good for vampires
reviews.text: On first impressions the hotel is very smart and the staff were all very friendly throughout. The over-riding thing I do not like about this hotel is how dark it is and lacking in natural light both in the rooms and the common areas. I know this is the "look" they may be trying to achieve but rather than having a nice ambience it just felt gloomy. It was so dark that the waitress at breakfast was having to strain her eyes to find my name on the printed guest list! Food in the restaurant was nice - I had the cooked breakfast there. All in all a lovely hotel, just turn up the lights a bit!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a lovely hotel located next to the Royal Liver Building. Upon check in we were a little bit disappointed with the welcome and service received. We had a long wait and didn't receive an apology.
reviews.title: Lovely Night Away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was 308 which was at the back of the building overlooking the mutli-storey car park. At first we thought it would be really noisy however this wasn't the case and we had a peaceful night sleep. The room was spacious, clean and decoration was of a high standard. We had a bath aswell as a shower. The bath was very big and can easily fit two people in (tried and tested). However I would say that the bed was really hard and the only soft item was the pillows. There was a fully stocked mini bar which is very pricey (£1.60 can of diet coke! etc).
reviews.title: A great hotel
Food and drink
reviews.text: All in all this was a lovely stay we didn't eat or drink in the hotel and opted out of the breakfast at a cost of £13.95!

reviews.title: A lovely hotel. Service a little lacking....
reviews.text: The city centre is approx. 10-15min walk and Albert Dock area is probably the same distance.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013
reviews.text: Faultless! The staff are so polite and helpful, the whole hotel is spanking clean, I've always had a fantastic experience. I have stayed several times both in Liverpool on business and pleasure and will definitely be back to stay in the future!
reviews.title: Loved this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Just returned from a great stay at malmaison liverpool. Hotel in a great location near many of the main liverpool attractions such as maritime museum, beatles museum. We ate in the hotel on Sunday night and the meals were lovely. Compliments to the chef. Waiting staff at breakfast and those serving drinks were excellent and took an interest in our trip. Nice to stay at a hotel with a good powerful shower! Be sure to visit the cavern club, amazing!
reviews.title: highly recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: Just got back from a weekend at Malmaison Liverpool where we celebrated our daughters wedding. What a weekend, we could not have been treated better. The wedding went without a hitch mainly due to fantastic staff at the hotel. Our guests who stayed over all agreed what a great place and our family from Canada were suitably impressed. the food at the wedding and throughout the week end was fabulous, the staff were great nothing was too much trouble. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel both as a place to stay and a wedding venue. Again a big thank you to everyone.
reviews.title: Best ever wedding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great hotel,in a great location, but let down by simple service issues you should experience with a hotel of this standard. Had to chase the kitchen of Saturday morning to start the breakfest service after we turned up at the advertised time. They did not clean our room on the second day because we wanted to get back into it around 3pm. Silly things let this down and really smacks of a place that is all substance, but can't follow through on its service
reviews.title: A nice hotel but .....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013
reviews.text: This hotel is on one of the quays and looks out over the river, some rooms have wonderful views. The hotel is modern in design and very comfortable and cosy inside. The staff were all friendly and welcoming. Our room was great, a lovely big bed and a luxurious shower - both of which you expect from Hdv and malmaison. Breakfast was yummy, again as you'd expect, can't wait to return to Liverpool and stay here again.
reviews.title: Ferry cross the Mersey

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had one night at the Malmaison last Friday, as we were in Liverpool to see Glen Campbell in concert at the Empire. The whole experience was fabulous. The booking was made through lastminute.com, and included an upgrade to a river view room. Usually when booking in using this kind of offer, it's a struggle to actually receive the upgrades - not here; the receptionist knew exactly what the conditions of the booking were. We were given a gorgeous room on the 4th floor, had a reservation made in the brasserie and a taxi booked to take us to the concert all within 5 minutes of checking in. He was extremely friendly and efficient. Thank you!
reviews.title: Glen Campbell stayed here too!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loved the room; it was spacious, comfortable and very stylish. I thought the minibar idea was excellent - and the prices were good too. I only wish we had been staying for more than one night. As we only had an hour or so before the concert, I didn't have enough time to enjoy the room as much as I wanted to!
reviews.title: Great stay at the Mal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Glen Campbell was also fabulous.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: Let's face it - Liverpool isn't exactly awash with great hotels. So it was a great relief to see Malmaison open up in the Albert Dock area.
reviews.title: About as good as Liverpool has to offer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I have to say it's a lovely hotel, although not quite as good as it thinks it is.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, apart from some brasserie staff!

likes.liked: — The rooms: nice decor, very clean, private!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The dark decor, all black and aubergine, is a bit passe to be honest.
reviews.title: Fab....with some easily resolved flaws

likes.disliked: — The bathroom flooding, and dirty sheets

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was great, although not entirely sure about having the toilet in the wet room part of the bathroom! Shower was great.
reviews.title: I want that one

likes.disliked: — That I didnt know about the car parking! thats all.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bar was lovely, restaurant fine and parking not too much bother as there's a contract muti-storey next door when you can park for free.
reviews.title: Good hotel and excellent pizza

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 1 night with my husband. The location by the dock was really nice, it was easy to find and I loved how close it was to Liverpool 1 and Albert Dock. The hotel is very modern yet grand and the rooms were very large compared to other hotels of a similar price. The room had a lovely big bed, a massive TV and a very impressive bathroom with a huge bath and amazingly good shower.
reviews.title: Chic, modern, luxurious hotel by the docks.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013
reviews.text: Breakfast in the morning was £15.95, I did think this was a bit steep but the eggs Benedict with salmon were perfectly cooked. The continental selection was also varied and fresh.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: All in all, a very good hotel, the bed was a little hard for my liking but still would stay here again on my next trip to Liverpool without a doubt.
reviews.title: Not cheap but very good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Room was great with views over the river, bath was massive and very clean. Stayed on a sunday night special with 2 course dinner and cocktails. Dinner was very nice and service top quality. Definitely stay here again next time we're in Liverpool.
reviews.title: Good location and very friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is good.
reviews.title: Very nearly 5 star review

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I wanted to take my husband to Liverpool so that he could do the tour around the beloved Anfield stadium and looked for somewhere a bit different for our one night stay. I was not disapointed!
reviews.title: It takes a lot to impress me!

likes.liked: — Decor, staff, food, little extra touches

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The place is very sylish, liked the colour scheme/lighting very much (although I did find it a bit difficult to read the menu at night) and were very impressed by the staff.
reviews.title: Fantastic service

likes.disliked: — Empty minibar which you had to fill via reception

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ate in the restauarnt at night - best entrecote steak I have had in a long time. Loved breakfast.
reviews.title: Sleek, modern, perfectly detailed

likes.disliked: — Finding it was a bit difficult

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thought the room (although quite small but we were on a special deal) was great especially the bathroom! and the free goodies.
reviews.title: Kept in the dark!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only thing I would comment on is the fact the hotel has no parking of its own and you have to park in the car park next door. £15 a day is quite hefty (can't they do a deal for hotel customers) and if you are staying for a couple of nights, hikes the bill up a bit.
reviews.title: Good but not great.

likes.liked: — The reception area was impressive. The bathroom was good. Soaps are great too.
